availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Washington (Fairfax County, Virginia, President and Commander and Chief of the Continental Army)

body.p: Fairfax County, Virginia, commander of the Continental Army and President of the United States. Virginia native. Son of Augustine Washington and Mary Call Washington. Married Martha Dandridge Custis Washington on January 6, 1759 at the Custis house on the Pamunkey River, Colony of Virginia. Surveyor in Culpeper County, Colony of Virginia in 1749. Served as District Adjutant of Virginia Militia with a rank of Major in 1752. Commander of Virginia Regiment in 1755. Member of the House of Burgesses in 1758. Elected Commander-in-Chief of the Continental Army in 1775. President at Constitutional Convention in 1787. Elected President of the United States April 30, 1789. At the time of his death in Mount Vernon, Virginia on December 14, 1799, Washingtonâ€™s estate owned 317 enslaved persons.

ab.bibl: Henry Wiencek, "George Washington (1732-1799)" in Encyclopedia of Virginia, Brendon Wolfe, ed., https://www.encyclopediavirginia.org/GeorgeWashington1732-1799#startentry (Accessed on April 5, 2019). John E. Ferling, _The First of Men: A Life of George Washington (Knoxville: University of Tennessee Press, 1988), 31-60.
